field.name: summary
field.value: PerWcfSession throws NullReferenceException when not in a session

field.name: description
field.value: When a WCF service does not have session behavior enabled, the PerWcfSession lifestyle of the WCF Facility throws a NullReferenceException. A more useful error message should be thrown, e.g. "The current operation is not executing in the context of a WCF session."

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: Is it beta 1 or some older version?

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
Since there is no test case attached to reproduce exactly the problem you've had I'm not sure if I'm hitting the same case you're describing.
Currently if you try to resolve a component that's scoped (like with session) outside of the scope, you'll get the following exception:
{{Castle.MicroKernel.ComponentResolutionException : Could not obtain scope for component Castle.Facilities.WcfIntegration.Tests.Components.One. This is most likely either a bug in custom IScopeAccessor or you're trying to access scoped component outside of the scope (like a per-web-request component outside of web request etc)}}
I think that's good enough, so I'm going to close this issue.
